GeneDef.label: psionist
GeneDef.description: Psionists have an innate connection to the psychic fields many royals use. This connection allows them to manipulate psychic energy far better than any human should be able to.\n\nThis can have weird interactions with VPE. Most things will work, but because this gene and the Psionic Soldier increase psychic sensitivity, this can end up having strange effects. For example, someone on the Discord server was able to confirm that the Frost Ray ability was channeling for so long that it was starving the Psionist.

customEffectDescriptions.li: Required gene for all psionic paths.

GeneDef.label: hemomancer
GeneDef.description: Hemomancers, contrary to popular belief, don't gain their abilities from being superheroes, but from a mutated version of the hemogenic gene.\n\nThe prerequisite for this gene is Hemogenic, not the Superhero Gene.

customEffectDescriptions.li: When the carrier consumes a hemogen pack they have a chance to gain a new hemomancy gene. The success rate declines as they gain more genes.
If the carrier gains an ability/effect through the above effect that relies on hemomancy proficiency and they don't have a gene that provides that, it will not be immediately useable.

HediffDef.label: hemomancer
HediffDef.description: This pawn's ability to control blood allows them to slow the rate that they lose blood from open wounds.

HediffDef.label: picking hemomancy gene
HediffDef.description: This pawn will generate new genes once you STOP LOOKING AT DEVMODE STUFF AND UNPAUSE YOU CHEATER. Unless you're a fellow modder, in which case welcome! You won't get much use from this tooltip, but the SHG_ArchetypesMain.xml file contains the randomization data for this hediff.

GeneDef.label: radiomancer
GeneDef.description: Radiomancers manipulate the energies of their body and the air around them to create extraordinary effects. Unlike Psionists and Hemomancers, Radiomancers deal with energy in its purist form, allowing them to gain radioactive energy from various sources, though they can't store much at any given time.
GeneDef.resourceDescription: A special form of radiation that a specific type of superhero can generate and dissipate using energy reactions within their body.

customEffectDescriptions.li: This resource is only gained and lost through the use of abilities.
Gives the Gather Energy ability to radiomancers that have neither the Bioreactor or Solar Recharging genes.
Gives the Dissipate Energy ability to radiomancers that have neither the Condense Radiation or Refocus Energy genes.

GeneDef.label: electromancer
GeneDef.description: Electromancers specialize in the weaponization of electricity, from the electronics disabling EMPs to flesh frying lightning.

GeneDef.label: petrimancer
GeneDef.description: Petrimancers specialize in petrifying opponents, and are vital in any colony that relies on large numbers of prisoners or slaves.

GeneDef.label: pyromancer
GeneDef.description: Pyromancer specialize in burning everything around them to ashes, and usually the only way to stop them involves a lot of fireproofing.

GeneDef.label: cryomancer
GeneDef.description: Pyromancer specialize in inflicting debilating frostbite upon all their foes.

GeneDef.label: caustimancer
GeneDef.description: Caustimancers specialize in throwing acid around, and frequently get banned from bars after a fight because of the mess they leave behind.

GeneDef.label: toximancer
GeneDef.description: Toximancers tend to play more of a supporting roll on the battlefield because their blasts seldom kill anyone directly, but are excellent for forcing people to flee to new cover.

GeneDef.label: hydromancer
GeneDef.description: Hydromancers shoot out streams of water at high pressures that can both kill fires and put out enemies.

GeneDef.label: pugilist
GeneDef.description: Pugilists have been called many different things throughout the years, like boxers, brawlers, and martial artists. They tend to rely more on their equipment and training over their archetype.

GeneDef.label: medic
GeneDef.description: For Medics, there's always new person to patch up, a new triage clinic to tend to, a new person to bring back from the brink of death.

GeneDef.label: life bringer
GeneDef.description: The very existence of Life Bringers defies common sense and the natural order. Those under the Life Bringer's care will find that wounds never last long, and death is little more than an inconvenience.

GeneDef.label: druid
GeneDef.description: Most believe that Druids seek to have balance with nature, to ensure it is not disrupted. This belief is what caused people to begin calling Druids as such, and it was only reinforced when they found their own animals turning against them.

GeneDef.label: skirmisher
GeneDef.description: Skirmishers specialize in fighting on the front lines, and being an overall pain to pin down.

GeneDef.label: analyzer
GeneDef.description: Analyzers are capable of viewing everything around them with extreme detail, and use this power to take down foes with extreme precision.

GeneDef.label: porter
GeneDef.description: Porters are capable of transporting large amounts of people and things from place to place with ease. While they themselves usually don't have much assistance to provide in direct combat, their abilities are still valued highly in any army or raiding party as all due to their ability to transport entire armies on a whim.

GeneDef.label: hacker
GeneDef.description: Hackers excel when fighting mechanoids. Their excellence comes not from how much destruction they cause, but from the destruction the mechanoids can cause after they hack the strongest one.

GeneDef.label: anti-hero
GeneDef.description: When all hope is lost, when the villains run rampant and unkillable monsters infest the lands, the Anti-hero will be there. They turn strengths into weakness, and tear apart their enemies with brutal efficiency.

GeneDef.label: firefighter
GeneDef.description: Firefighters specialize in exactly what their name states, fighting fires. Should push come to shove their water abilties can also be turned to a more violent purpose as the high pressure water those abilities shoot is capable of destroying limbs.

GeneDef.label: stunner
GeneDef.description: Stunners specialize in using their superhuman beauty as a weapon, distracting their enemies, allies, and sometimes themselves.

GeneDef.label: ninja
GeneDef.description: Ninjas are masters of the art of misdirection. With a smoke bomb here and a poison blast there, their enemies often end up running around blind, only realizing their target escaped when it's too late.

GeneDef.label: phantom
GeneDef.description: Phantoms are master assassins, capable of ignoring every minefield and barricade in their way, while also having the ability to camouflage themselves in any environment. When their invisibility falls, they become easier to stop, but by then it may be too late.

customEffectDescriptions.li: Super will always be floating at least a little bit over the ground.

GeneDef.label: biomancer
GeneDef.description: Biomancers are capable of creating plants from seemingly nothing. These plants, usually trees and exotic plants, can survive in situations that would normally be inhospitable.

GeneDef.label: farmer
GeneDef.description: Farmers are often overlooked in more advanced worlds, but their ability to create crops that thrive even on solid stone can often save a struggling colony or tribe.

GeneDef.label: chemist
GeneDef.description: With a little bit of time and equipment, a Chemist can easily create a stable supply of a variety of drugs, from lifesaving ones made from healroot to potent narcotics made from psychoid plants.

GeneDef.label: geomancer
GeneDef.description: Unlike most supers with earth based powers, Geomancers have difficulty manipulating anything other than normal stones. However, through a lot of practice they have mastered this ability in a way that allows them to move stone precisely, leaving just valuable resources left.

GeneDef.label: ferromancer
GeneDef.description: Ferromancers specialize in moving mass amounts of metal from far undergound to the surface. They can also use their innate metal control to ensure they always have the best results when extracting resources from a location.

GeneDef.label: midas
GeneDef.description: While a Midas can't actually turn things into gold, they frequently gather large amounts of wealth by pulling precious resources from deep underground to themselves, usually ordering someone else to break it apart in exchange for a couple trinkets.

GeneDef.label: monster slayer
GeneDef.description: All across the land there are beasts and machines and unimaginable horrors that seek to wipe out all human life, and monster slayers seek to return the favor. Their supernatural precision allows them to take down many of these foes with ease, and their telepush and telepull abilities allow them to make sure those foes will be right where the slayer needs them to be.

GeneDef.label: dormant super
GeneDef.description:
At some point in this super's lineage, the superhero gene was introduced but never activated. While this pawn will likely never become a true super, one of their children may suddenly become far greater than their ancestors.

Assuming no mods alter inheritence, there is a 50% for a given gene to be inherited if one parent has it, and a 100% chance of inheriting the gene if both do. Assuming the gene inheritence system doesn't mess up, these are the chances of a child being a true super.

Both have Super: 50% Super 50% Dormant
Only one Super: 25% Super 25% Dormant 25% Both Lost 25% Complete Disappointment
